metadata.title: CVE-2017-3600 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Client mysqldump). Supported versions that are affected are 5.5.54 andearlier, 5.6.35 and earlier and 5.7.17 and earlier. Difficult to exploitvulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access viamultiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of thisvulnerability can result in takeover of MySQL Server. Note: CVE-2017-3600is equivalent to CVE-2016-5483. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 6.6 (Confidentiality,Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3600` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-client - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-server - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libmariadbclient18 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libmariadbd18 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-client - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-client-10.1 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-client-core-10.1 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-common - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-connect - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-spider - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1

mariadb-server-core-10.1 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.18-0ubuntu1').
mariadb-10.1 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
